abstract: Dozens of female employees at Israeli Knesset attend work in skirts that end above their knees; move is intended to protest renewed efforts by parliamentary body's guards to enforce longstanding dress code requiring dignified dress; women compare enforcers of code to modesty police in conservative religious societies.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of female employees arrived at the Knesset in above-the-knee outfits to protest what they said was a sudden shift in enforcing a longstanding dress code.
snippet: Dozens of female employees arrived at the Knesset in above-the-knee outfits to protest what they said was a sudden shift in enforcing a longstanding dress code....

headline.main: Israel’s Parliament Draws a Line on Short Hemlines
headline.print_headline: In Israel, Parliament Draws a Line on Hemlines
